conclusion: Determine the capacitance of the cylindrical capacitor.
Capacitance C is given by C = (2π ε₀ l) / ln(b/a).
Calculate the energy stored in the capacitor.
Energy U is given by U = (1/2) C V².
Substitute the capacitance into the energy formula.
Substituting C into U gives U = (1/2) ((2π ε₀ l) / ln(b/a)) V².
Simplified expression for U is U = (π ε₀ l V²) / ln(b/a).
Final answer: Total energy stored is U = (π ε₀ l V²) / ln(b/a).
